name: mine construction, underground, hard coal | mine infrastructure, underground, hard coal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6687/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of an underground mine for mining hard coal. Life time is assumed to be the same as for opencast mines for mining lignite. Thus, an average life time of 30 years is considered for machinery. ;;Data represent first approximations due to the insufficient availability of data. The estimates are based on data about a few underground mines: Donetsk/Kuznetsk (former UdSSR), Trimmelkam, Schmitzberg (Austria) and Tahmoor (Australia). Hence, only figures per tone hard coal were given in literature and no information about average annual production of hard coal was available. Due to these facts a total production of 100 million tons has been assumed to represent a worldwide average (excluding small mines in China). This estimation includes both opencast and underground mines; therefore the total production shall be seen more as a normalization factor than an actual average value for the production of underground mines.;;Due to the fact that hard coal has to be treated, higher figures for infrastructure are considered. It has to be considered that this dataset is based on few data about underground mines thus it may not reflect specific mines. Even with a broader database it would not have been possible to calculate assured mean values. This is due to the fact that there are big differences between mines and complete data of several hundred mines would have been required. ;;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From unspecified land forseen for an underground mine for hard coal mining.

This activity ends with an underground mine unit for hard coal mining. This dataset includes machinery and equipment with a life time of 30 years because this information is not seperated in the literature given. It also includes requirements for prospecting.Concrete for filling the pit after abandonment of the mine is considered. Land use is included as well. In this dataset explosives are considered via blasting.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Resource Extraction; Fuels

exchanges.description:
Estimation. In underground mines almost exclusively hard coal is mined. Exceptions are Austria, Spain and Eastern Europe. Due to the fact that coal in Europe is primarily mined underground and coal imported to Europe originate to 50 % from underground mines, European conditions should be heavily weighted. 

Significant material amounts are required for coating of adits and struts. Thus, high specific values for material consumption are estimated. Underground transport equipment (conveyors, trains) and mining machines (incl. support scaffolding) have to be taken into account as well.

After operation it is assumed that all materials except from wood on the surface are left in situ.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO

flow.name: mine infrastructure, underground, hard coal
flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. Due to the fact that hard coal is embedded in hard rocks blasting is assumed. Therefore, high amounts of explosives are required. The amount of explosives required is considered in this module.

flow.category: F:Construction/43:Specialized construction activities/431:Demolition and site preparation/4312:Site preparation

exchanges.description:
Estimation. In this dataset specific concrete consumption of 6.5 kg/t pit coal is used. The amount of concrete which is required for filling the pit after abandonment of the mine is considered in the dataset. Assuming a shaft depth of 500 meters and a shaft diameter of 5 m an amount of concrete of 10000 m3 can be estimated. In Levin a model of an underground mine is calculated. The figures given in Levin differ from the estimated values in this dataset even after consideration of reference values. In this literature values for concrete of 29,2 kg per t usable output were calculated. Values for concrete differ by a factor of 3. Data given in Levin is used to estimate uncertainties. 


Further references:

Estimations based on data in <http://www.ruhrbergbau.de> , 20.8.2003.
EcoSpold01Location=CH

exchanges.description:
Estimation. In this dataset specific sanwood consumption of 6.997 kg/t pit coal is used. Taking the total wood consumption both for opencast and underground mines into account, in underground mines above ground wood consumption is the same as used for opencast mines, the rest is used underground. Underground wood consumption is required during operation of the mine, however it is considered in the infrastructure dataset.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. In this dataset specific sanwood consumption of 6.997 kg/t pit coal is used. Taking the total wood consumption both for opencast and underground mines into account, in underground mines above ground wood consumption is the same as used for opencast mines, the rest is used underground. Underground wood consumption is required during operation of the mine, however it is considered in the infrastructure dataset.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
Estimations. In this dataset specific copper consumption of 0,002 kg/t pit coal is used. In Levin a model of an underground mine is calculated. The figures given in Levin differ from the estimated values in this dataset even after consideration of reference values. In this literature values for copper of 0.017 kg per t usable output were calculated.Values for copper differ by a factor of 5. Data given in Levin is used to estimate uncertainties.
EcoSpold01Location=RER
